intro: Lysimachia lancifolia, commonly known as narrow-leaved yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Lysimachia lancifolia is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate appearance and ability to spread through rhizomes.
